page.title: 20GEN.SIR JOHN CONCLUSION.
page.content: al he went to a village called Ede.The house was plain,small,but peaceful.He liked it in Holland.He was afraid the Germans would find him.He had a hiding place.In the evening the family gath- ered and had an apple.Every day he went for a walk.He had twelve holes in his stomach.He had a hole in his leg. The Dutch Resistance helped him escape.He was just able to go.He wore civilian clothes and had his battle clothes in a bundle.He was sad when he left but knew he had to go.His wife got messages that he was dead,she also heard that he was alive,the truth was kept secret.In the end he came home safely.Sir John lives in retirement now,he keeps brown trout in the mill pond.Much of his time is spent in tra- velling to lectures around the country and appearing on television.He doesn't have enough time to work on his book!
